Arlene Schnitzer Concert Hall.label: Arlene Schnitzer Concert Hall, Portland
Arlene Schnitzer Concert Hall.description: The Arlene Schnitzer Concert Hall, opened as the Portland Publix Theater before becoming the Paramount after 1930, is a historic theater building and performing arts center in Portland, Oregon, United States. Wikipedia

Deutsches Schauspielhaus.label: Deutsches Schauspielhaus
Deutsches Schauspielhaus.description: The Deutsches Schauspielhaus is a theatre in the St. Georg quarter of the city of Hamburg, Germany. With a capacity for 1192 spectators, it places it as Germany's largest theatre. Wikipedia

Haymarket Theatre.label: Haymarket Theatre
Haymarket Theatre.description: The Theatre Royal Haymarket is a West End theatre in the Haymarket in the City of Westminster which dates back to 1720, making it the third-oldest London playhouse still in use. Wikipedia
Haymarket Theatre.type: Theatre in City of Westminster, England

Prince Edward Theatre.label: Prince Edward Theatre
Prince Edward Theatre.description: The Prince Edward Theatre is a West End theatre situated on Old Compton Street, just north of Leicester Square, in the City of Westminster. Wikipedia
Prince Edward Theatre.type: Theatre in City of Westminster, England

Sadler's Wells Theatre.label: Sadler's Wells Theatre
Sadler's Wells Theatre.description: Sadler's Wells Theatre is a performing arts venue located in Rosebery Avenue, Clerkenwell in the London Borough of Islington. The present day theatre is the sixth on the site since 1683. Wikipedia

Theater Basel.label: Theater Basel
Theater Basel.description: Theater Basel is the municipal theatre of the city of Basel, Switzerland, which is home to the city's opera and ballet companies. The theatre also presents plays and musicals in addition to operas and operettas. Wikipedia

Abbey Theatre.label: Abbey Theatre
Abbey Theatre.description: The Abbey Theatre, also known as the National Theatre of Ireland, in Dublin, Republic of Ireland, first opened its doors to the public on 27 December 1904. Wikipedia

Apollo Theater Chicago.label: Apollo Theater Chicago
Apollo Theater Chicago.description: The Apollo Theater Chicago was built in Chicago's Lincoln Park neighborhood in 1978. Located at 2540 N. Lincoln Ave., the Apollo has 440 seats and a lobby featuring art exhibits and a full bar. Wikipedia

Comédie-Française.label: Comédie-Française
Comédie-Française.description: The Comédie-Française or Théâtre-Français is one of the few state theatres in France. It is the only state theatre to have its own troupe of actors. The company's primary venue is the Salle Richelieu. Wikipedia

Gaiety Theatre, Dublin.label: Gaiety Theatre, Dublin
Gaiety Theatre, Dublin.description: The Gaiety Theatre is a theatre on South King Street in Dublin, Ireland, off Grafton Street and close to St. Stephen's Green. It specialises in operatic and musical productions, with occasional dramatic shows. Wikipedia

Odéon-Théâtre de l'Europe.label: Odéon-Théâtre de l'Europe
Odéon-Théâtre de l'Europe.description:
The Odéon-Théâtre de l'Europe is one of France's six national theatres.
It is located at 2 rue Corneille in the 6th arrondissement of Paris on the left bank of the Seine, next to the Luxembourg Garden. Wikipedia

Royal Opera House.label: Royal Opera House, London
Royal Opera House.description: The Royal Opera House is an opera house and major performing arts venue in Covent Garden, central London. Wikipedia
Royal Opera House.type: Opera House in City of Westminster, England

Théâtre Antoine-Simone Berriau.label: Théâtre Antoine-Simone Berriau
Théâtre Antoine-Simone Berriau.description:
Théâtre Antoine-Simone Berriau is a theater located at 14 boulevard de Strasbourg in the 10th arrondissement of Paris.
The 800-seat Italian Style theater was built in the year 1866. Wikipedia

Théâtre Hébertot.label: Théâtre Hébertot
Théâtre Hébertot.description: Théâtre Hébertot is a theatre at 78, boulevard des Batignolles, in the 17th arrondissement of Paris, France. The theatre, completed in 1838 and opening as the Théâtre des Batignolles, was later renamed Théâtre des Arts in 1907. Wikipedia

Théâtre Marigny.label: Théâtre Marigny
Théâtre Marigny.description: The Théâtre Marigny is a theatre in Paris, situated near the junction of the Champs-Élysées and the Avenue Marigny in the 8th arrondissement. Wikipedia

Théâtre de l'Atelier.label: Théâtre de l'Atelier
Théâtre de l'Atelier.description: The Théâtre de l'Atelier is a theatre at 1, place Charles Dullin in the 18th arrondissement of Paris. Wikipedia

Théâtre des Capucines.label: Théâtre des Capucines
Théâtre des Capucines.description: The Théâtre des Capucines was a former theatre on the boulevard des Capucines in the 2nd arrondissement of Paris. Wikipedia

Théâtre des Champs-Élysées.label: Théâtre des Champs-Élysées
Théâtre des Champs-Élysées.description: The Théâtre des Champs-Élysées is a theatre at 15 avenue Montaigne. The theater is named not after the famed Avenue des Champs-Élysées, but rather after the neighborhood which it is situated in, the Quartier des Champs-Élysées. Wikipedia

Vaudeville Theatre.label: Vaudeville Theatre
Vaudeville Theatre.description: The Vaudeville Theatre is a West End theatre on the Strand in the City of Westminster. As the name suggests, the theatre held mostly vaudeville shows and musical revues in its early days. Wikipedia
Vaudeville Theatre.type: Theatre in City of Westminster, England

Artsdepot.label: artsdepot
Artsdepot.description: The artsdepot is a multi-purpose cultural centre located in North Finchley, in the London borough of Barnet. It was officially opened on 23 October 2004 for the enjoyment and development of the arts in North London. Wikipedia

Barbican Centre.label: Barbican Centre
Barbican Centre.description: The Barbican Centre is a performing arts centre in the City of London and the largest of its kind in Europe. The centre hosts classical and contemporary music concerts, theatre performances, film screenings and art exhibitions. Wikipedia

Bush Theatre.label: Bush Theatre
Bush Theatre.description: The Bush Theatre is based in Shepherd's Bush, in the London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham. It was established in 1972 and has since become one of the most celebrated new writing theatres in the world. Wikipedia

Byham Theater.label: Byham Theater
Byham Theater.description: The Byham Theater is a landmark building at 101 Sixth Street in the Cultural District of Downtown Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States. Wikipedia

Charles Playhouse.label: Charles Playhouse
Charles Playhouse.description: The Charles Playhouse of Boston, Massachusetts, is a theater at 74 Warrenton Street in the Boston Theater District. Blue Man Group and Shear Madness currently perform there. Wikipedia

Criterion Theatre.label: Criterion Theatre
Criterion Theatre.description: The Criterion Theatre is a West End theatre situated on Piccadilly Circus in the City of Westminster, and is a Grade II* listed building. It has an official capacity of 588. Wikipedia
Criterion Theatre.type: Theatre in City of Westminster, England

Ferguson Center for the Arts.label: Ferguson Center for the Arts
Ferguson Center for the Arts.description: The Ferguson Center for the Arts is a theater and concert hall on the campus of Christopher Newport University in Newport News, Virginia, USA. The complex fully opened in September 2005 with two concert halls and many other facilities. Wikipedia

Guthrie Theater.label: Guthrie Theater
Guthrie Theater.description: The Guthrie Theater, founded in 1963, is a center for theater performance, production, education, and professional training in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Wikipedia

Lobero Theatre.label: Lobero Theatre
Lobero Theatre.description: The Lobero Theatre, originally founded by José Lobero in 1873, is a historic building in Santa Barbara, California. It is at the corner of Anacapa and Canon Perdido Streets, less than a block away from the historic Presidio of Santa Barbara. Wikipedia

Massey Hall.label: Massey Hall
Massey Hall.description: Massey Hall is a performing arts theatre in the Garden District of downtown Toronto. The theatre originally was designed to seat 3,500 patrons but, after extensive renovations in the 1940s, now seats up to 2,765. Wikipedia

Morton H. Meyerson Symphony Center.label: Morton H. Meyerson Symphony Center, Dallas
Morton H. Meyerson Symphony Center.description: The Morton H. Meyerson Symphony Center is a concert hall located in the Arts District of downtown Dallas, Texas. Wikipedia

Merle Reskin Theatre.label: Merle Reskin Theatre
Merle Reskin Theatre.description: The Merle Reskin Theatre is a performing arts venue located in the Loop community area of Chicago, Illinois. Originally named the Blackstone Theatre, it was founded in 1910. Wikipedia

Pioneer Playhouse.label: Pioneer Playhouse
Pioneer Playhouse.description: The Pioneer Playhouse, located in Danville, Kentucky, is the oldest outdoor theater in the state of Kentucky. Wikipedia

Richmond Theatre.label: Richmond Theatre
Richmond Theatre.description: The present Richmond Theatre, in the London Borough of Richmond upon Thames, is a British Victorian theatre located on Little Green, adjacent to Richmond Green. Wikipedia

South London Theatre.label: South London Theatre
South London Theatre.description: The South London Theatre is a Community theatre in West Norwood in the London Borough of Lambeth, England. Wikipedia

Teatro Tapia.label: Teatro Tapia
Teatro Tapia.description: Teatro Alejandro Tapia y Rivera, is among the oldest free-standing drama stage buildings under U.S. flag still in use. It is located in San Juan, Puerto Rico. It is named after Alejandro Tapia y Rivera, a Puerto Rican poet and dramatist. Wikipedia

Wilbur Theatre.label: Wilbur Theatre
Wilbur Theatre.description: Wilbur Theatre is a historic theater at 244-250 Tremont Street in Boston, Massachusetts. The Wilbur Theatre was originally opened in 1914 but was revitalized in 2008. Wikipedia

La MaMa Experimental Theatre Club.label: La MaMa Experimental Theatre Club
La MaMa Experimental Theatre Club.description: La MaMa Experimental Theatre Club is an off-off Broadway theatre founded in 1961 by Ellen Stewart, and named in reference to her. Wikipedia

Baxter Theatre Centre.label: Baxter Theatre Centre, Cape Town
Baxter Theatre Centre.description: The Baxter Theatre Centre is a performing arts complex in Rondebosch, a suburb of Cape Town, South Africa. Wikipedia

The Public Theater.label: Public Theater
The Public Theater.description: The Public Theater is a New York City arts organization founded as The Shakespeare Workshop in 1954 by Joseph Papp, with the intention of showcasing the works of up-and-coming playwrights and performers. Wikipedia
Awards: Tony Award for Best Revival of a Musical
Drama Desk Award for Unique Theatrical Experience
Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Revival of a Musical
Nominations: Tony Award for Best Revival of a Play
Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Musical
Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Play
Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Revival of a Play
Drama Desk Award for Outstanding RevivalMore

Damascus Opera House.label: Damascus Opera House
Damascus Opera House.description: The Damascus Opera House is the national opera house of Syria. Inaugurated on 7 May 2004, it is located in central Damascus, on the Umayyad Square. Wikipedia

London Coliseum.label: London Coliseum
London Coliseum.description: The London Coliseum is a theatre in St. Martin's Lane, central London, built as one of London's largest and most luxurious ‘family’ variety theatres. Wikipedia
London Coliseum.type: Theatre in City of Westminster, England

Albany Theatre.label: Albany Theatre
Albany Theatre.description:
The Albany is a multi-purpose arts centre in Deptford, south-east London.
Facilities include a flexible performance space holding up to 300 seated or 600 standing and a bar, two studio theatres, a performance cafe and rehearsal / meeting rooms. Wikipedia

Ambassadors Theatre.label: Ambassadors Theatre London
Ambassadors Theatre.description: The Ambassadors Theatre, is a West End theatre located in West Street, near Cambridge Circus on the Charing Cross Road in the City of Westminster. Wikipedia
Ambassadors Theatre.type: Theatre in City of Westminster, England

Avalon Theatre.label: Avalon Theatre
Avalon Theatre.description: The Avalon Theatre is a historic theater located in downtown Easton, Maryland. Originally built as a cinema in 1921, The Avalon was billed as the "Showplace of the Eastern Shore." Wikipedia

Bellevue Teatret.label: Bellevue Teatret
Bellevue Teatret.description: The Bellevue Teatret is a theatre in Klampenborg at the northern outskirts of Copenhagen, Denmark. Opened in 1936 to the design of Arne Jacobsen, the building is considered one of his most important ... Wikipedia

Birmingham Repertory Theatre.label: Birmingham Repertory Theatre
Birmingham Repertory Theatre.description: Birmingham Repertory Theatre is a theatre and theatre company based on Centenary Square in Birmingham, England. It is one of the most influential companies in the history of the English Stage. Wikipedia

Curran Theatre.label: Curran Theatre
Curran Theatre.description: The Curran Theatre is located in San Francisco and was named by its first owner, Homer Curran. The theatre is currently owned by Carole Shorenstein Hays and is operated by SHN Wikipedia

Copacabana (nightclub).label: Copacabana
Copacabana (nightclub).description: The Copacabana is a famous New York City nightclub. Many entertainers, among them Danny Thomas, Pat Cooper and the comedy team of Martin and Lewis, made their New York debuts at the Copacabana. Wikipedia

Curtain Theatre.label: Curtain Theatre
Curtain Theatre.description: The Curtain Theatre was an Elizabethan playhouse located in Curtain Close, Shoreditch, just outside the City of London. It opened in 1577, and continued staging plays until 1622. Wikipedia

Empire, Leicester Square.label: Empire, Leicester Square
Empire, Leicester Square.description: The Empire is a large cinema on the north side of Leicester Square, in the City of Westminster, London. It is one of many large cinemas in, and adjoining, the Square which are used for film premières and first runs. Wikipedia

De Montfort Hall.label: De Montfort Hall
De Montfort Hall.description: De Montfort Hall is a music and performance venue in Leicester, England. It is situated adjacent to Victoria Park and is named after Simon de Montfort, Earl of Leicester. Wikipedia

Fitzgerald Theater.label: Fitzgerald Theater
Fitzgerald Theater.description: The Fitzgerald Theater is the oldest active theatre in Saint Paul, Minnesota, and the home of American Public Media's A Prairie Home Companion. Wikipedia

Fortune Theatre, Dunedin.label: Fortune Theatre, Dunedin
Fortune Theatre, Dunedin.description: New Zealand's Fortune Theatre is located on the corner of Moray Place and Upper Stuart Street, in the heart of the southern city of Dunedin. Wikipedia

Grand Opera House, Belfast.label: Grand Opera House, Belfast
Grand Opera House, Belfast.description: The Grand Opera House is a theatre in Belfast, Northern Ireland, designed by the most prolific theatre architect of the period, Frank Matcham. It opened on 23 December 1895. Wikipedia

Haymarket Theatre (Leicester).label: Haymarket Theatre
Haymarket Theatre (Leicester).description: The Haymarket Theatre was a theatre in Leicester, England, based in the Haymarket Shopping Centre on Belgrave Gate in Leicester city centre. The theatre closed at the end of 2006 and has been replaced by the Curve Theatre. Wikipedia

Imperial Theatre.label: Imperial Theatre, Saint John
Imperial Theatre.description: The Imperial Theatre, in Saint John, New Brunswick, was designed by Philadelphia architect Albert Westover and built in 1912 by the Imperial Theatre by the Keith-Albee-Orpheum Corporation vaudeville ... Wikipedia

Koncerthuset.label: The Koncerthuset
Koncerthuset.description: The Koncerthuset by Jean Nouvel is a part of the new DR Byen, that houses the Danish Broadcasting Corporation, DR. The concert hall and the DR Town are located in the northern part of Ørestad - an ambitious development area in Copenhagen, Denmark. Wikipedia

Georgian Theatre Royal.label: Georgian Theatre Royal
Georgian Theatre Royal.description: The Georgian Theatre Royal is a theatre and historic Georgian playhouse in the market town of Richmond, North Yorkshire, England. It is among the oldest of Britain's extant theatres. Wikipedia

Landmark Theater (Richmond, Virginia).label: Landmark Theater
Landmark Theater (Richmond, Virginia).description: The Altria Theater in Richmond, Virginia, United States is a theater at the southwest corner of Monroe Park, the largest venue of Richmond CenterStage's performing arts complex. Wikipedia

Limerick Athenaeum.label: Limerick Athenaeum
Limerick Athenaeum.description: Limerick Athenaeum was a centre of learning, established in Limerick city, Ireland, in 1852. Wikipedia

Loew's Grand Theatre.label: Loew's Grand Theatre
Loew's Grand Theatre.description: Loew's Grand Theater, originally DeGive's Grand Opera House, was a movie theater at the corner of Peachtree and Forsyth Streets in downtown Atlanta, Georgia, in the United States. Wikipedia

London Palladium.label: London Palladium
London Palladium.description: The London Palladium is a 2,286 seat West End theatre located off Oxford Street in the City of Westminster. Wikipedia
London Palladium.type: Theatre in City of Westminster, England

Lyceum Theatre, London.label: Lyceum Theatre
Lyceum Theatre, London.description: The Lyceum Theatre is a 2,100-seat West End theatre located in the City of Westminster, on Wellington Street, just off the Strand. There has been a theatre with this name in the locality since 1765. Wikipedia

Lyric Theatre (Hammersmith).label: Lyric Theatre
Lyric Theatre (Hammersmith).description: The Lyric Theatre, also known as the Lyric Hammersmith, is a theatre in King Street, in the London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham, which takes pride in its original, "groundbreaking" productions. Wikipedia

Majestic Theatre (Broadway).label: Majestic Theatre
Majestic Theatre (Broadway).description: The Majestic Theatre is a Broadway theatre located at 245 West 44th Street in midtown Manhattan. It is one of the largest Broadway theatres with 1,645 seats, and traditionally has been used as a venue for major musical theatre productions. Wikipedia

Mark Taper Forum.label: Mark Taper Forum
Mark Taper Forum.description: The Mark Taper Forum is a 739-seat thrust stage at the Los Angeles Music Center designed by Welton Becket and Associates on the Bunker Hill section of downtown Los Angeles. Wikipedia
Architect: Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Play

Marlowe Theatre.label: Marlowe Theatre
Marlowe Theatre.description:
The Marlowe Theatre is a major 1,200-seat theatre in Canterbury, England.
It closed in March 2009 for redevelopment and a brand-new Marlowe Theatre reopened on 4 October 2011. Wikipedia

Mississippi Nights.label: Mississippi Nights
Mississippi Nights.description: Mississippi Nights was a music club in St. Louis, Missouri. It was located at 914 N 1st Street, on the western bank of the Mississippi River, four blocks north of the Gateway Arch in Laclede's Landing. Wikipedia

Neil Simon Theatre.label: Neil Simon Theatre
Neil Simon Theatre.description: The Neil Simon Theatre, formerly the Alvin Theatre, is a Broadway venue built in 1927 and located at 250 West 52nd Street in midtown-Manhattan. Wikipedia

O2 Apollo Manchester.label: O2 Apollo Manchester
O2 Apollo Manchester.description: The O2 Apollo Manchester is a concert venue in Ardwick Green, Manchester, England. Locally known as The Apollo, it is a Grade II listed building, with a capacity of 3,500. Wikipedia

Philharmonie Luxembourg.label: Philharmonie Luxembourg
Philharmonie Luxembourg.description: The Grande-Duchesse Joséphine-Charlotte Concert Hall is a concert hall located on the Kirchberg plateau in the City of Luxembourg. Opened in 2005, it now plays host to 400 performances each year and is one of the main concert halls in Europe. Wikipedia

Phoenix Theatre (London).label: Phoenix Theatre
Phoenix Theatre (London).description:
The Phoenix Theatre is a West End theatre in the London Borough of Camden, located on Charing Cross Road. The entrance is in Phoenix Street.
The theatre was designed by Sir Giles Gilbert Scott, Bertie Crewe and Cecil Massey and is Grade II listed. Wikipedia

Queen's Film Theatre.label: Queen's Film Theatre
Queen's Film Theatre.description: The Queen's Film Theatre or QFT is a small independent cinema at Queen's University Belfast, Northern Ireland that was founded in 1968. Wikipedia

Queen's Theatre, Hornchurch.label: Queen's Theatre, Hornchurch
Queen's Theatre, Hornchurch.description:
The Queen's Theatre, Hornchurch is a 500-seat theatre located in Hornchurch in the London Borough of Havering, east London.
The theatre opened in its current purpose-built site on Billet Lane, Hornchurch in 1975. Wikipedia

Royal & Derngate.label: Royal & Derngate
Royal & Derngate.description: Royal & Derngate is a theatre complex in the Cultural Quarter of Northampton, England, consisting of the Royal Theatre, the Derngate Theatre and the Errol Flynn Filmhouse. Wikipedia

Studio 54.label: Studio 54
Studio 54.description: Studio 54 was a popular New York nightclub from 1977 until 1981 when it was sold by founders and creators Steve Rubell and Ian Schrager. Wikipedia

Théâtre national de Chaillot.label: Théâtre national de Chaillot
Théâtre national de Chaillot.description: The Théâtre National de Chaillot is a theatre located in the Palais de Chaillot at 1, place du Trocadero, in the 16th arrondissement of Paris. Wikipedia
Address: 1 Place du Trocadéro et du 11 Novembre

The Playhouse, Weston-super-Mare.label: The Playhouse, Weston-super-Mare
The Playhouse, Weston-super-Mare.description: The Playhouse is a 664-seat theatre in Weston-super-Mare in southwest England that hosts shows all year round including opera, ballet, comedy, music and pantomime performances. Wikipedia

The Ritz (Manchester).label: The Ritz
The Ritz (Manchester).description: The Ritz is a live music venue in Whitworth Street West in Manchester, England. Built in 1927, The Ritz was designated a Grade II listed building on 6 June 1994. The venue is notable for its sprung dance floor. Wikipedia

The Seagull (theatre).label: The Seagull
The Seagull (theatre).description: The Seagull is a theatre and cinema in Pakefield, a suburb of Lowestoft in Suffolk, run almost entirely by volunteers from the local community. Wikipedia

The Tabernacle.label: The Tabernacle
The Tabernacle.description: The Tabernacle, known colloquially as The Tabby, is a mid-size concert hall in the U.S. city of Atlanta. Wikipedia

The Thekla.label: Thekla
The Thekla.description: Thekla is a cargo ship moored in the Mud Dock area of Bristol's Floating Harbour, England. Originally brought to Bristol as the Old Profanity Showboat, it was a late 1982 brainchild of novelist Ki Longfellow-Stanshall, the wife of Vivian Stanshall. Wikipedia

Theatre Royal, Brighton.label: Theatre Royal, Brighton
Theatre Royal, Brighton.description: The Theatre Royal, Brighton is a theatre in Brighton, England, United Kingdom presenting a range of West End and touring musicals and plays, along with performances of opera and ballet. Wikipedia

Theatre Royal, Dumfries.label: Theatre Royal, Dumfries
Theatre Royal, Dumfries.description: The Theatre Royal in Dumfries, Scotland is a the oldest working theatre in Scotland. The Theatre is owned by the Guild of Players who bought it in 1959, thereby saving it from demolition. Wikipedia

Theatre Royal, Plymouth.label: Theatre Royal, Plymouth
Theatre Royal, Plymouth.description: The Theatre Royal Plymouth in Plymouth, Devon, England is "the largest and best attended regional producing theatre in the UK and the leading promoter of theatre in the south west", according to Arts Council England. Wikipedia

Trafalgar Studios.label: Trafalgar Studios
Trafalgar Studios.description: Trafalgar Studios, formerly the Whitehall Theatre until 2004, is a West End theatre in Whitehall, near Trafalgar Square, in the City of Westminster, London. Wikipedia
Trafalgar Studios.type: Theatre in City of Westminster, England

Tricycle Theatre.label: Tricycle Theatre
Tricycle Theatre.description: The Tricycle Theatre is located on Kilburn High Road in Kilburn in the London Borough of Brent, England. Wikipedia
